title: Netflix's cold war with rivals turns hot as Apple and Disney enter the fray
text:
Reed Hastings does not have the air of a man who loses sleep over his competition, unless that competition is sleep itself.

“You get a show or a movie you’re really dying to watch, and you end up staying up late at night, so we actually compete with sleep,” Netflix’s chief executive once said. The implication was that the video streaming service is so powerful, so compelling, that only the biological requirement to recharge could stand in its way.

Hastings has listed almost everything as a challenge to his company’s path to dominance, Fortnite, YouTube and broadcast TV among them. Almost everything, because Netflix has been surprisingly relaxed about one source of competition in particular:...
description: Reed Hastings does not have the air of a man who loses sleep over his competition, unless that competition is sleep itself.
